author: Jeff Piker (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Apaches thump Subiaco 49-7
text: slideshow SUBIACO â€” The Pottsville Apaches got back on the winning track Friday night as they traveled to Subiaco to take on the Trojans. The Apaches combined big plays and a stingy defense to route the Trojans 49-7 in 4-4A conference play."It was good for us to get out of the gate fast tonight," Apaches head coach Bryan Rust said. "We played pretty well in the first half on both sides of the ball."Pottsville established the tone of the game with their first drive. The Apaches took the opening kick off at their 33-yard line. The Apaches marched down the field in seven plays with Austin McNeely going in from 11 yards out for the touchdown. Michel Gomes added the PAT kick and Pottsville took a 7-0 lead less than three minutes into the first quarter.On a Trojans first possession the Apaches defense forced a fumble, and Pottsville started their second possession at its own 10-yard line. Josh Duggar took the hand off and outraced the Subiaco defense for the 90-yard score. Gomez again added the PAT and Pottsvilles lead was 14-0.On the Apaches next possession, the drive started at their own 11-yard line. After moving the ball to their own 20-yard line Pottsville faced a fourth-and-1. Quarterback Jake Dugger busted through the middle of the Trojan defense and scampered 80 yards for the score. The extra point gave Pottsville a 21-0 to lead with 30 seconds left in the first quarter.The Trojans returned the kickoff and set up their only score of the game. Running back James Wells broke a tackle at the line of scrimmage and went 27 yards to put the Trojans on the board with 23 seconds left in the opening quarter. The Trojans added the PAT and closed the gap to 21-7.On Pottsville's next possession it was Alec Metz's turn to break a long run against the Trojans. On second-and-6 at the Pottsville 39-yard line, he took the pitch and ran 61 yards to increase the Apache lead to 27-7.Pottsville added their final score of the half with 1:10 on the clock, when Dugger again connected with Price. The throw and catch went for 28 yards. The PAT gave Pottsville a 42-7 lead at the half.Pottsville's final score of the evening came when Travis Monk carried the ball across the goal line with just over a minute left in the contest to set the final score.The Apaches offense racked up over 520 yards while the defense held the Trojans to only 57 yards of total offense. Pottsville's Josh Duggar led all rushers with 140 yards. Jake Dugger added 98 and Metz added 92.Next week Pottsville travels to Little Rock to face Pulaski Robinson.
